user.biography: Featuring the world's best adventure photographers, athletes, and trips.

node.text: Short film by @taylorglenn | We all know people whose dedication to a passion or purpose inspires us deeply. Gannett Horn's (@surfasaur) focus on his sport and love for its community embodies the best in each of us. This short film is a testament to Gannett and those who motivate us to work harder at the things we love. #riversurfing Production by @apresvisuals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 14, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text: Photo by @robinoneill / It's so rare to be able to get this perspective on a trail feature. Squamish, B.C.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 13, 2021. May be an image of nature and ocean.

node.text: Photo by @guillermocerveraphoto / Winter is about to come—swells and photos. Surfer @manuellezcano

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 13, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text: Photo by @christianpondella / Human flight, one can only imagine the feeling of flying through the Swiss Alps near the town of Grindelwald, Switzerland.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 12, 2021. May be an image of one or more people.

node.text:
Photo by Nikki Smith @nikkik_smith / Lynn Hill @_linacolina_ one of the most accomplished rock climbers in the world onsights Ultrasaurus in the Flatirons above Boulder, Colorado.
📍Cheyenne, and Núu-agha-tʉvʉ-pʉ̱ (Ute)+ lands

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 12, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, nature and ocean.

node.text: Photo by @erinhogue / Quiet contemplation in moments between waves. @mariefranceroy off Vancouver Island, B.C.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 10, 2021. May be an image of mountain and nature.

node.text: Photo by @paulzizkaphoto / Fellow adventurer @trixie_ stands on top of Mount Byng, a lesser-known peak on the border of Alberta's Banff National Park and British Columbia's Mount Assiniboine Provincial Park. This image was taken in July just days before wildfire smoke engulfed the region. From that vantage point—and blessed with clear skies—we were able to admire peaks over a hundred kilometers (or 62 miles) away.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 10, 2021. May be an image of lightning and nature.

node.text: Photo by @mikeolbinski / Capturing lightning at the Grand Canyon is something I try a few times every summer here during the Arizona monsoon, and it's always a challenge. But on August 17, despite a long day of struggling to be in the right spot and my camera missing daytime bolts, we were treated to this spectacular lightning strike landing on the cliffs of the North Rim. Lightning does tend to hit high points, but it's kind of a myth that it always seeks them out. As evidenced here, the lightning traveled down the side of the canyon wall and struck hundreds of feet down. An incredible sight, one of my all-time favorite photos, period!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 09, 2021. May be an image of nature, ocean and coast.

node.text: Photo by @erinhogue / The natural power of the ocean as it quietly communicates with the moon in a language we may never understand. @tyler_nicholson @adamdjunaedi @marcos_r_miranda in Hawaii.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 09, 2021. May be an image of nature and waterfall.

node.text: Photo by @paulzizkaphoto / Have you heard of the Torngats? The Rocky Mountains of western Canada are famous around the world, but you can also find some incredible ranges on the eastern side of the country. The Torngat Mountains stretch from the northern tip of Newfoundland and Labrador to eastern Quebec. This Inuit homeland takes its name from the Inuktitut word "tongait," which means "place of spirits."

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 08, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and nature.

node.text: Photo by @christianpondella / In front of the camera with @realwillgadd doing his thing. An insight into adventure photography and one of my favorite type of photo projects, hanging on the side of a frozen waterfall working one-on-one with a great friend!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 08, 2021. May be an image of bicycle and nature.

node.text: Photo by @praveenjayakaran / @goodwave_adventures enjoying his manual on the top of Handi Gundi betta at Ramnagara, Bengaluru. #mtb #shredd #sendit #outdoors #storm

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Geographic Adventure on September 07, 2021. May be an image of nature and sky.

node.text: Photo by @paulzizkaphoto / Crimson cliffs frame a star-filled sky and the Milky Way on a previous trip to Mongolia. Dreaming about exploring more of this incredible landscape someday!
